Anybody that says this movie was less than mediocre is crazy.  I don't know what people expect of movies these days after millions have been made and many, MANY are redundant.  They've never done a movie like this before and I can most guarantee there won't be a Blindsided 2, 3 or 4 like everything else out there.  I thought it was very well written, good story line, great acting and suspenseful.  A gripping thriller and I enjoyed it very much.  I ordered it months ago when it was still only available oversea's and called "Penthouse North" - I couldn't watch it on my DVD player, only on my laptop and remember watching it while waiting for a severely delayed flight for a business trip.  I couldn't wait to see if it would become available on regular DVD and was pleased when it did.  This is a must see for every movie fan who enjoy suspense/thriller movies. You won't be disappointed!
Extremely well done. Great plot
A remake of "Wait Until Dark", with more gore. Do yourself a favor and check out the original.
This is an enjoyable film that comes across like a play at times.  I liked the way it wrapped up quite a bit.  I'm pretty sure it was at least partly meant as a nod to Batman.

more emotion in this movie than others I've seen her in. Michael Keaton always plays a creepy bad guy well. I thought Blindsided was a good movie that held my interest until the end.

I bought this one on a whim and am so glad that I did. The movie is very suspenseful and will hold your interest to the very end. Keaton knows how to play an evil lunatic to the hilt. Michelle Monahan  was very believable as the blind victim.

A well done suspense. Great job done by Michael Keaton and Michelle Monaghan. The story line is believable and holds your attention. Not too violent.  Just enough to keep you on your toes.

Based on the recent Oscar performance, the film industry has opted to cash in by resurrecting and repackaging a sinker Keaton made. This film was originally the flop, "Penthouse North."  $9.88 US Walmart

Sarah (Michelle Monaghan) is a war photographer who gets blinded by a suicide bomber. The film starts three years later. We get an indication Sara is a strong person. She lives in an expensive Penthouse with a rich boyfriend (Andrew Walker). It isn't long before this becomes a home break-in film with Michael Keaton and Barry Sloane as the bad guys. It seems her boyfriend wasn't as nice as she thought.

There must be a 100 home break-in films out there, some even involve a blind person. While not a bad film, this one doesn't bring anything new worthwhile to the table. A film you can wait to see.

Parental Guide: No sex or nudity. 7 f-bombs.
An excellent film.  The script and actors were superb !  I highly recommend this film.

It's always disappointing to watch a potentially good movie nosedive.  Seemed this movie banked on selling Michael Keaton's involvement with the film, not the film's story.
I would watch anything with Michael.  He is his typical self exciting.
This was a pretty good movie.  Reminded me of the movie many years ago where the girl was blind and won over a male intruder.
It is okay.

This was an exciting thriller that had a few twists.  I always enjoy Michael Keaton and this film was another vehicle that showcased his incredible talent.  I am dating myself, but this one reminded me of "Wait Until Dark".  The violence seemed over the top, but I understand the reasons why it was deemed necessary.  Overall, this was a heart pounding ride.
GOOD MOVIE

The story was pretty tight.  It was well put together.  Keaton's character was along the lines of his Pacific Heights character.  I prefer his
multiplicity performance.  The violence was excessive at times.  However, I enjoyed the diamond on the ledge scene.
At times I wondered where everyone else in the building was.  Didn't anyone wonder about the doorman?  I would have
liked to have seen more cast members.
Well acted and keeps you in suspense through the enteir moveie.

Just watched this movie not too long ago. I would not choose this to be a family movie but for adults its a keeper. For me there are few movies I do not mind watching number of times Blindsided is a good example.

If you liked this movie, you'll love " Wait until Dark" staring Audry Hepburn, Alain Arkin ( in his first major film role) and Richard Crena. I'm not saying Blindsided copied Wait Until Dark, but they kinda did.
